chunks.chunk_text: We are closely watching many many of our superstar players and also our break dancers.I'm keen.My vote goes to our break dancing team and all the dancers there.I think they're fantastic.I think it's the first time that Olympics included break dancing as one of the sport categories.So good luck to them.Let's see how our dancers break a leg.

chunks.chunk_text: So guys,let's come back to the Olympics.All right.And Clem,you must be following the Olympics right now and it's really nail-biting moments,right?Different countries,we're fighting for that silver gold medal,silver gold medal,bronze silver medal,the one second,that final moment,you know,it's nail-biting moments like this that makes Olympic Games such a very important event in our lives.

chunks.chunk_text: There's a cute guy running hundred meters or swimming the hundred meters,hey,or break dancing.Yeah,and for the guys,for us,it's more like about the one hundredths of a second,split second difference between all the different athletes.You know,we live for that very competitive moment,the nail biting moments for me.All right.So,Clem,since you are on the show today,that means we got to talk about food.

chunks.chunk_text: And since we started off with Olympics,I'm curious,as Olympians,if you are training to be an Olympian,you must eat healthy,you must eat good,right?Okay.So what are the Olympians eating at the Olympic Village in Paris this year?Are they eating all French food and croissant and drinking coffee?I don't know.I mean,are they going all French or are they eating very Asian,very healthy,or are they going vegetarian?

chunks.chunk_text: is actually,it's actually served and catered by one food provider called the Sodexo Live.All right.Sodexo Live.And it is the largest catering job to ever exist this time around.So they had one vendor,one provider,Sodexo Live that serves all the food at the Olympic Village.All right.And so we're talking about serving food 24-7,24 hours,

chunks.chunk_text: 24-7 days,okay,through the entire Paris 2024 Games.And how many people?3,500 seater eateries.So if you go to the Olympic Village,there are many,many cafeterias and eateries,and Sodexo Live will serve the 3,500 people seaters every day,24-7,24 hours a day,7 days a week.So if you're Olympian,you can eat,eat,eat,eat,eat,eat,eat,eat,eat,eat,eat all day.

chunks.chunk_text: That's also because you compete at different times of the day,right?Because there are few days you compete and few days you are not competing.And once you lose,you go home.You don't stay there.It's not a guest house.It's not a hotel.It's not a guest house.So if you happen to lose and you probably pack your bags and you go home.But Sodexo Live,the catering house is serving 3,500 people every day,24-7.That is an amazing job.That's crazy.

chunks.chunk_text: Okay.So,Clem,can you quickly give us some of the signature dishes available for these athletes so we can quench our mouth-watering desires?Okay.Because this friend,it is Paris,so let's start with croissant.Okay.Let's start with croissant.Croissant.Croissant.Okay.法国人不要骂我们。And Americans will be croissant,right?You have to pronounce it the English way,croissant.

chunks.chunk_text: And then the French people would be croissant,right?And then,of course,it really depends,guys.You know,to me,if you eat real authentic French croissant,then you will be able to pronounce croissant.But if it's made in Taiwan or made in America,then it's croissant.So how do you eat croissant?How do I eat croissant?Okay.Well,the Starbucks way.Salt or sweet?The Starbucks way is savory,right?Ham and cheese or beef and cheese.

chunks.chunk_text: And for me,croissant has to be croissant,just plain croissant.I don't like anything in it.I don't like any jam or any chocolate cream in it.I like it original.So you like to eat directly?Original.The original croissant.Butter croissants.And how about you?To me,it can be adding sweet fillings or just eat it directly and with a cup of coffee.And a cup of coffee,yes.You got to go all French.You can't go halfway.

chunks.chunk_text: That's the first dish.This is very French.So I think this is a thumbs up for me.This is thumbs up.Good croissant.Mix cheese.You know,cheese and croissant.You would never go wrong with that.And then egg.Come on.A little bit of protein is always good.Okay.What's the next dish?How about the Turkish dish?There's a Turkish dish called chicken tender.Oh,okay.World cuisine.Chicken tender.So this tender.

chunks.chunk_text: I've seen it spelled as T-A-N-D-O-O-R.And tender means grilled in a little oven,right?This round thingy.Yeah.Round clay oven that they use.So either it's bread that's cooked or baked in this oven or it's chicken or it's lamb or it's a meat dish that's cooked in this oven.To me,all good.Grilled chicken is never wrong.So chicken tender.Very,very nice.It's never wrong.

chunks.chunk_text: But this is more like Middle Eastern Turkish,right?Yeah.Middle Eastern Turkish.Okay.Yeah.Good.So I do know my dishes.Good.Okay.Chicken tender wouldn't go wrong.How worldly this is.I don't know.Depends on the spices,I guess.If they make it Asian spices,then it's worldly fusion.But chicken tender.I think all cultures have some sort of grilled chicken like this.So to you,it's not that worldly?

chunks.chunk_text: You know,to me,you know,Clem,now today,long,long time ago,in the West,it's kind of cool to,it's kind of cool to eat like,I don't know if you remember back in the day when we were much younger.One time I visited Taipei and then at one stage there was,it was a popular food truck at the night markets called Schwama's,right?And,you know,I saw it in the Taiwan Night Market.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins英語咖啡館 Ep.236_ 巴黎給世界殿堂的選手們吃什麼What did the athletes get to eat in Paris thi.json

chunks.chunk_text: And I didn't understand it.I was like,okay,Schwama,that looks like a little,you know,bread with meat in the middle.And then they slice the meat off like a massive kebab.And then only later on,I note,I learnt that,you know,it's also a very Middle Eastern,Central Asian type food.Schwama's and these type of,you know,carveries.They have meat that they hang up in a kebab form.And then they roasted it and they would slice it.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins英語咖啡館 Ep.236_ 巴黎給世界殿堂的選手們吃什麼What did the athletes get to eat in Paris thi.json

chunks.chunk_text: And then they would slice the meat off like that.It's a way of cooking.It's a way of grilling meat.So to me,it's just very slowly cooked,grilled meat in a bun or a bread,right?And with a little bit of sauce,with a little bit of something.And obviously,the spices would be a little different to what we're used to.But to me,it's just barbecue chicken or barbecue meat.You're right.It's a kind of barbecue.Yeah,it's just different kind of barbecue,right?It just,sometimes you are really hungry
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins英語咖啡館 Ep.236_ 巴黎給世界殿堂的選手們吃什麼What did the athletes get to eat in Paris thi.json

chunks.chunk_text: and you want to barbecue quicker.This is the type that you really have patience.You barbecue it slowly.So to make sure that the meat that is sliced off the schwama,the massive kebab is still juicy.So to me,it's just a way of barbecue.So I would say to me,this is a worldly cuisine,yes.But to me,again,because I've seen it,I've experienced it and we had it in Taiwan
chunks.original_filename: RSS_1442509198_podcast_1304_15Mins英語咖啡館 Ep.236_ 巴黎給世界殿堂的選手們吃什麼What did the athletes get to eat in Paris thi.json
